intro: Feliciotis sessilicordata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
